1.long: already; now at length, now after all this waiting.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

1.brief: second, in the second place, for the second time
1.long: second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time.
I write; pass: it is written, it stands written (in the scriptures).

1.brief: I wake out of sleep, I arouse
1.long: I wake out of sleep, arouse in general, stir up.
remembrance, recollection, putting in mind; a reminder.

2.long: I remember, call to mind, recall, mention.
I tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly.
a thing spoken, (a) a word or saying of any kind, as command, report, promise, (b) a thing, matter, business.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
a prophet, poet; a person gifted at expositing divine truth.

2.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
2.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.

3.long: first, in the first place, before, formerly.

3.brief: I come to know, learn, realize
3.long: I am taking in knowledge, come to know, learn; aor: I ascertained, realized.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.

3.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
3.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.
last, at the last, finally, till the end.
a day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

3.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
3.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.

3.brief: desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust
3.long: desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust.

3.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
3.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

4.long: (denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
(a) presence, (b) a coming, an arrival, advent, especially of the second coming of Christ.

4.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
4.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
I fall asleep, am asleep, sometimes of the sleep of death.

4.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
4.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
(a) rule (kingly or magisterial), (b) plur: in a quasi-personal sense, almost: rulers, magistrates, (c) beginning.
(often of the founding of a city), (a) abstr: creation, (b) concr: creation, creature, institution; always of Divine work, (c) an institution, ordinance.

5.long: I am hidden (concealed), lie hid, escape notice, sometimes with acc. of person from whom concealment takes place; I do so and so unconsciously, unknown to myself, I shut my eyes to so and so.

5.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
5.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
I will, wish, desire, am willing, intend, design.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
heaven, (a) the visible heavens: the atmosphere, the sky, the starry heavens, (b) the spiritual heavens.
the earth, soil, land, region, country, inhabitants of a region.

5.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.

5.brief: I commend, prove, am composed of, cohere
5.long: I place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; I am composed of, cohere.

5.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.

the world, universe; worldly affairs; the inhabitants of the world; adornment.

7.long: the, the definite article.

judging, judgment, decision, sentence; generally: divine judgment; accusation.

impious, ungodly, wicked.

17.brief: I lead away with, condescend to
17.long: I lead away with, carry along with (in good or bad sense according to context); mid: I conform myself willingly to.

17.brief: I fall out, fall off, fall away, fade away, wither away
17.long: I fall out, fall off, fall away; hence in nautical language: I fall off from the straight course; of flowers: I fade away, wither away; I fall from, lose, forfeit; I am cast ashore; I am fruitless.

18.brief: an age, a cycle of time
18.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

18.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
18.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.
